abstract: Rochdale, a small brokerage firm in Connecticut, is barely hanging on after one of its traders placed a billion-dollar bet on Apple stock that did not pay off.
snippet: Rochdale, a small brokerage firm in Connecticut, is barely hanging on after one of its traders placed a billion-dollar bet on Apple stock that did not pay off.
lead_paragraph: Hours before Apple announced its earnings late last month, a trader at a small Connecticut brokerage firm placed a bet on the outcome of the technology giant’s results. It was the sort of speculative trade that happens any given day on Wall Street.

headline.main: Big Bet Sours, Imperiling Small Firm
headline.print_headline: Big Bet Sours, Imperiling Small Firm

byline.original: By Susanne Craig and Peter Lattman
